title: Initiate a transcription (Deprecated)
use_cases: How to start a transcription job with Gladia?
How to enable diarization in transcription?

How to enable translation during transcription?
content:
# Initiate a transcription (Deprecated)

**DEPRECATED**: Prefer the more specific [pre-recorded endpoint](/api-reference/v2/pre-recorded/init).

Initiate a pre-recorded transcription job. Use the returned id and the GET /v2/transcription/:id endpoint to obtain the results.

## Endpoint

```
POST /v2/transcription
```

## Authorization

- **x-gladia-key** (string, header, required): Your personal Gladia API key

## Request Body (application/json)

### Required Parameters

- **audio_url** (string, uri, required): URL to a Gladia file or to an external audio or video file
  - Example: `"http://files.gladia.io/example/audio-transcription/split_infinity.wav"`

### Optional Parameters

- **context_prompt** (string, deprecated): Context to feed the transcription model with for possible better accuracy
- **custom_vocabulary** (boolean, default: false): Enable custom vocabulary for this audio
- **custom_vocabulary_config** (object): Custom vocabulary configuration
  - **vocabulary** (array): List of vocabulary items
  - **default_intensity** (number): Default intensity value
- **detect_language** (boolean, default: true, deprecated): Use `language_config` instead. Detect the language from the given audio
- **enable_code_switching** (boolean, default: false, deprecated): Use `language_config` instead. Detect multiple languages
- **language** (enum, deprecated): Use `language_config` instead. Set the spoken language (ISO 639 standard)
- **callback_url** (string, uri, deprecated): Use `callback`/`callback_config` instead
- **callback** (boolean, default: false): Enable callback for this transcription
- **callback_config** (object): Customize the callback behaviour (url and http method)
- **subtitles** (boolean, default: false): Enable subtitles generation
- **subtitles_config** (object): Configuration for subtitles generation
- **diarization** (boolean, default: false): Enable speaker recognition (diarization)
- **diarization_config** (object): Speaker recognition configuration
- **translation** (boolean, default: false, beta): Enable translation
- **translation_config** (object, beta): Translation configuration
- **summarization** (boolean, default: false, beta): Enable summarization
- **summarization_config** (object, beta): Summarization configuration
- **moderation** (boolean, default: false, alpha): Enable moderation
- **named_entity_recognition** (boolean, default: false, alpha): Enable named entity recognition
- **chapterization** (boolean, default: false, alpha): Enable chapterization
- **name_consistency** (boolean, default: false, alpha): Enable names consistency
- **custom_spelling** (boolean, default: false, alpha): Enable custom spelling
- **structured_data_extraction** (boolean, default: false, alpha): Enable structured data extraction
- **sentiment_analysis** (boolean, default: false): Enable sentiment analysis
- **audio_to_llm** (boolean, default: false, alpha): Enable audio to LLM processing
- **custom_metadata** (object): Custom metadata you can attach to this transcription
- **sentences** (boolean, default: false): Enable sentences
- **display_mode** (boolean, default: false, alpha): Change output display mode
- **punctuation_enhanced** (boolean, default: false, alpha): Use enhanced punctuation
- **language_config** (object): Specify the language configuration

## Example Request

```bash
curl --request POST \
  --url https://api.gladia.io/v2/transcription \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --header 'x-gladia-key: <api-key>' \
  --data '{
    "audio_url": "http://files.gladia.io/example/audio-transcription/split_infinity.wav",
    "diarization": true,
    "subtitles": true
  }'
```

## Response (201 - Created)

```json
{
  "id": "45463597-20b7-4af7-b3b3-f5fb778203ab",
  "result_url": "https://api.gladia.io/v2/transcription/45463597-20b7-4af7-b3b3-f5fb778203ab"
}
```

### Response Fields

- **id** (string, uuid, required): Id of the job
- **result_url** (string, uri, required): Prebuilt URL with your transcription id to fetch the result

## Error Responses

- **400**: Bad Request
- **401**: Unauthorized - Invalid API key
- **422**: Unprocessable Entity

# Get transcription result (Deprecated)

**DEPRECATED**: Prefer the more specific [pre-recorded endpoint](/api-reference/v2/pre-recorded/get).

Get transcription's status, parameters and result.

## Endpoint

```
GET /v2/transcription/{id}
```

## Authorization

- **x-gladia-key** (string, header, required): Your personal Gladia API key

## Path Parameters

- **id** (string, required): Id of the transcription job
  - Example: `"45463597-20b7-4af7-b3b3-f5fb778203ab"`

## Example Request

```bash
curl --request GET \
  --url https://api.gladia.io/v2/transcription/{id} \
  --header 'x-gladia-key: <api-key>'
```

## Response (200 - OK)

```json
{
  "id": "45463597-20b7-4af7-b3b3-f5fb778203ab",
  "request_id": "G-45463597",
  "version": 2,
  "kind": "pre-recorded",
  "created_at": "2023-12-28T09:04:17.210Z",
  "status": "queued",
  "file": {
    "id": "f0dcZE10-23d8-47f0-a25d-74a6eed88721",
    "filename": "split_infinity.wav",
    "source": "http://files.gladia.io/example/audio-transcription/split_infinity.wav",
    "audio_duration": 20,
    "number_of_channels": 1
  },
  "request_params": {
    "audio_url": "http://files.gladia.io/example/audio-transcription/split_infinity.wav",
    "subtitles": false,
    "diarization": false,
    "translation": false,
    "summarization": false
  },
  "completed_at": null,
  "custom_metadata": null,
  "error_code": null,
  "result": null
}
```

### Response Fields

- **id** (string, uuid, required): Id of the job
- **request_id** (string, required): Debug id
- **version** (integer, required): API version
- **status** (enum, required): Job status
  - Available options: `queued`, `processing`, `done`, `error`
- **created_at** (string, datetime, required): Creation date
- **kind** (enum, default: pre-recorded, required): Available options: `pre-recorded`
- **completed_at** (string, datetime | null): Completion date when status is "done" or "error"
- **custom_metadata** (object): Custom metadata given in the initial request
- **error_code** (integer | null): HTTP status code of the error if status is "error" (range: 400-599)
- **file** (object): The file data you uploaded. Can be null if status is "error"
- **request_params** (object): Parameters used for this pre-recorded transcription
- **result** (object): Pre-recorded transcription's result when status is "done"

## Status Values

- **queued**: The job has been queued
- **processing**: The job is being processed
- **done**: The job has been processed and the result is available
- **error**: An error occurred during the job's processing

## Error Responses

- **401**: Unauthorized - Invalid API key
- **404**: Not Found - Transcription not found

# Delete transcription (Deprecated)

**DEPRECATED**: Prefer the more specific [pre-recorded endpoint](/api-reference/v2/pre-recorded/delete).

Delete a transcription and all its data (audio file, transcription).

## Endpoint

```
DELETE /v2/transcription/{id}
```

## Authorization

- **x-gladia-key** (string, header, required): Your personal Gladia API key

## Path Parameters

- **id** (string, required): Id of the transcription job
  - Example: `"45463597-20b7-4af7-b3b3-f5fb778203ab"`

## Example Request

```bash
curl --request DELETE \
  --url https://api.gladia.io/v2/transcription/{id} \
  --header 'x-gladia-key: <api-key>'
```

## Response

- **202**: The transcription job has been successfully deleted

## Error Responses

- **401**: Unauthorized - Invalid API key
  ```json
  {
    "timestamp": "2023-12-28T09:04:17.210Z",
    "path": "/v2/transcription/45463597-20b7-4af7-b3b3-f5fb778203ab",
    "request_id": "G-821fe9df",
    "statusCode": 401,
    "message": "gladia key not found"
  }
  ```
- **403**: Forbidden
- **404**: Not Found - Transcription not found

# List transcriptions (Deprecated)

**DEPRECATED**: Prefer the more specific [pre-recorded endpoint](/api-reference/v2/pre-recorded/list).

List all the transcriptions matching the parameters.

## Endpoint

```
GET /v2/transcription
```

## Authorization

- **x-gladia-key** (string, header, required): Your personal Gladia API key

## Query Parameters

- **offset** (integer, default: 0): The starting point for pagination. A value of 0 starts from the first item. (min: 0)
- **limit** (integer, default: 20): The maximum number of items to return. (min: 1)
- **date** (string, datetime): Filter items relevant to a specific date in ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD)
  - Example: `"2026-01-12"`
- **before_date** (string, datetime): Include items that occurred before the specified date in ISO format
  - Example: `"2026-01-12T00:00:09.657Z"`
- **after_date** (string, datetime): Filter for items after the specified date. Use with `before_date` for a range
- **status** (enum[]): Filter the list based on item status. Accepts multiple values
  - Available options: `queued`, `processing`, `done`, `error`
- **custom_metadata** (object): Filter by custom metadata
  - Example: `{ "user": "John Doe" }`
- **kind** (enum[]): Filter the list based on the item type
  - Available options: `pre-recorded`, `live`

## Example Request

```bash
curl --request GET \
  --url 'https://api.gladia.io/v2/transcription?limit=20' \
  --header 'x-gladia-key: <api-key>'
```

## Response (200 - OK)

```json
{
  "first": "https://api.gladia.io/v2/transcription?status=done&offset=0&limit=20",
  "current": "https://api.gladia.io/v2/transcription?status=done&offset=0&limit=20",
  "next": "https://api.gladia.io/v2/transcription?status=done&offset=20&limit=20",
  "items": [
    {
      "id": "45463597-20b7-4af7-b3b3-f5fb778203ab",
      "request_id": "G-45463597",
      "version": 2,
      "status": "done",
      "created_at": "2023-12-28T09:04:17.210Z",
      "kind": "pre-recorded",
      "completed_at": "2023-12-28T09:04:37.210Z",
      "file": {
        "id": "<string>",
        "filename": "<string>",
        "source": "<string>",
        "audio_duration": 3600,
        "number_of_channels": 1
      },
      "result": {
        "metadata": {
          "audio_duration": 3600,
          "number_of_distinct_channels": 1,
          "billing_time": 3600,
          "transcription_time": 20
        },
        "transcription": {
          "full_transcript": "<string>",
          "languages": ["en"],
          "utterances": []
        }
      }
    }
  ]
}
```

### Response Fields

- **first** (string, uri, required): URL to fetch the first page
- **current** (string, uri, required): URL to fetch the current page
- **next** (string, uri | null, required): URL to fetch the next page
- **items** (array, required): List of transcriptions

## Error Responses

- **401**: Unauthorized - Invalid API key

content:
# Upload a file

Upload a file for use in a pre-recorded job.

## Endpoint

```
POST /v2/upload
```

## Authorization

- **x-gladia-key** (string, header, required): Your personal Gladia API key

## Request Body

Supports both `multipart/form-data` and `application/json`.

### multipart/form-data

- **audio** (file): The file to be uploaded. This should be an audio or video file.

### application/json

You can also provide an audio URL in JSON format.

## Example Request

```bash
curl --request POST \
  --url https://api.gladia.io/v2/upload \
  --header 'Content-Type: multipart/form-data' \
  --header 'x-gladia-key: <api-key>' \
  --form audio='@example-file'
```

## Response (200 - OK)

```json
{
  "audio_url": "https://api.gladia.io/file/6c09400e-23d2-4bd2-be55-96a5ececfa3b",
  "audio_metadata": {
    "id": "6c09400e-23d2-4bd2-be55-96a5ececfa3b",
    "filename": "short-audio-en-16000.wav",
    "extension": "wav",
    "size": 365702,
    "audio_duration": 4.145782,
    "number_of_channels": 1,
    "source": "http://files.gladia.io/example/audio-transcription/split_infinity.wav"
  }
}
```

### Response Fields

- **audio_url** (string, uri, required): Uploaded audio file Gladia URL
  - Example: `"https://api.gladia.io/file/6c09400e-23d2-4bd2-be55-96a5ececfa3b"`
- **audio_metadata** (object, required): Uploaded audio file detected metadata
  - **id** (string): File ID
  - **filename** (string): Original filename
  - **extension** (string): File extension
  - **size** (integer): File size in bytes
  - **audio_duration** (number): Duration in seconds
  - **number_of_channels** (integer): Number of audio channels
  - **source** (string): Original source URL if provided

## Usage

After uploading, use the returned `audio_url` in the [Initiate a transcription](/api-reference/v2/pre-recorded/init) endpoint.

content:
# Transcript message (Live)

Payload definition for the message `transcript`.

This message contains the information about the transcript of the audio chunk.

## Message Schema

```json
{
  "session_id": "4a39145c-2844-4557-8f34-34883f7be7d9",
  "created_at": "2021-09-01T12:00:00.123Z",
  "type": "transcript",
  "data": {
    "id": "00-00000011",
    "is_final": true,
    "utterance": {
      "start": 123,
      "end": 123,
      "confidence": 123,
      "channel": 1,
      "words": [
        {
          "word": "<string>",
          "start": 123,
          "end": 123,
          "confidence": 123
        }
      ],
      "text": "<string>",
      "language": "en",
      "speaker": 1
    }
  }
}
```

## Fields

### Root Level

- **session_id** (string, required): Id of the live session
  - Example: `"4a39145c-2844-4557-8f34-34883f7be7d9"`
- **created_at** (string, required): Date of creation of the message. The date is formatted as an ISO 8601 string
  - Example: `"2021-09-01T12:00:00.123Z"`
- **type** (enum, default: transcript, required): Message type
  - Available options: `transcript`
- **data** (object, required): The message data

### Data Object

- **id** (string): Unique identifier for this transcript segment
- **is_final** (boolean): Whether this transcript is final or interim
  - `true`: Final transcript, will not be updated
  - `false`: Interim transcript, may be updated with more accurate text
- **utterance** (object): The transcribed utterance
  - **start** (number): Start time in milliseconds
  - **end** (number): End time in milliseconds
  - **confidence** (number): Confidence score
  - **channel** (integer): Audio channel number (default: 1)
  - **words** (array): Array of word objects
    - **word** (string): The transcribed word
    - **start** (number): Word start time in milliseconds
    - **end** (number): Word end time in milliseconds
    - **confidence** (number): Word confidence score
  - **text** (string): Full text of the utterance
  - **language** (string): Detected language code (ISO 639)
  - **speaker** (integer): Speaker identifier for diarization

## Usage

This message is received via WebSocket when using the [Live WebSocket](/api-reference/v2/live/websocket) endpoint. Monitor the `is_final` field to determine when a transcript segment is complete and stable.
